author: Rich Kirby
title: Monroe Police Hold Community Food Drive
text:
[Community Corner](/connecticut/monroe/around-town)
Monroe Police Hold Community Food Drive
Residents may drop off items for donation anytime at the Monroe Police Department through Nov. 25.
MONROE, CT — The Monroe Police Department is holding a community food drive benefiting the Monroe Food Pantry, in the days leading up to Thanksgiving.
Residents may drop off items for donation anytime at the Police Department on [7 Fan Hill Road](https://www.google.com/search?q=7+Fan+Hill+Road+monroe+ct&oq=7+Fan+Hill+Road+monroe+ct&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUyBggAEEUYOTIGCAEQLhhA0gEIMzY1NmowajGoAgCwAgA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8)through Nov. 25, or at the [Century Plaza/Big Y parking lot](https://www.google.com/search?q=535+Monroe+Turnpike&oq=535+Monroe+Turnpike&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUyBggAEEUYOTIGCAEQLhhA0gEHNjQ0ajBqMagCALACAA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. on Nov. 16.
Questions? Call 203.261.3622 or email CRO@MonroeCTPolice.com.

author: webinfo@adnkronos.com (Web Info)
title: Brindisi, non si fermano all'alt: carabiniere morto in seguito a sparatoria
text:
(Adnkronos) - Un carabiniere è morto in seguito ad una sparatoria avvenuta oggi, giovedì 12 giugno, dopo un inseguimento a Francavilla Fontana, nel in provincia di Brindisi. I fatti, secondo quanto apprende l'Adnkronos, sono accaduti alle 7 di questa mattina lungo la strada che conduce a Grottaglie, in prossimità della zona industriale. La dinamica è ancora da verificare.
In Breve
domenica 15 giugno
sabato 14 giugno
giovedì 12 giugno
Che tempo fa
Rubriche
TI RICORDI COSA È SUCCESSO L’ANNO SCORSO A GIUGNO?

author: muliana
title: Hércules, Renê e Cannobio devem fazer a estreia pelo Fluminense contra a Portuguesa RJ - Bolavip Brasil
text:
Fluminense Hércules, Renê e Cannobio devem fazer a estreia pelo Fluminense contra a Portuguesa RJ Fluminense irá encarar a Portuguesa-RJ pela 4ª rodada do Cariocão nesta qinta-feira à partir das 21h30 Por Marcelo Uliana
23/01/2025 - 19:00hs BRT
Fluminense tentará vencer a Portuguesa-RJ no Cariocão Portuguesa (RJ) e Fluminense encerram a quarta rodada do Campeonato Carioca na noite desta quinta-feira (23), às 21h30 (horário de Brasília), no Estádio Luso-Brasileiro. O Tricolor, que ainda não venceu na competição, contará com a presença de Mano Menezes pela primeira vez à frente da equipe nesta temporada.
Foto: Marcelo Gonçalves/FFC - Hércules anunciado pelo Fluminense O duelo não será dos mais fáceis haja vista que o a Lusa carioca está no G-4 do torneio estadual e o Fluzão ainda não terá 100% do seu elenco titular á disposição do técnico Mano Menezes.
 Jogadores como Thiago Silva, Fábio, Jhon Arias e Germán Cano provavelmente não estarão disponíveis nesta partida. Além disso, Paulo Henrique Ganso ficará fora do time por, pelo menos, um mês, devido a uma miocardite leve.
PUBLICIDADE PUBLICIDADE Renê, Cannobio e Hércules devem fazer suas estreias pelo Fluminense Por outro lado, três jogadores podem fazer suas estreias pelo time de Mano Menezez. O primeiro é o lateral-esquerdo Renê que chegou ao Flu sem custos após não renovar com o Internacional Além dele, quem poderá mostrar o seu futebol para torcida é Hércules.
Cannóbio também pode fazer sua estreia pelo Fluminense- Foto: Isabela Azine/AGIF
Contrato por R$ 27 milhões pelo Fluminense junto ao Fortaleza no final do ano passado, o volante terá a oportunidade de fazer sua partida de estreia pelo Fluzão. O Atleta é muito querido pelo time carioca e promete mostrar o seu valor a Mano Menezes.
PUBLICIDADE PUBLICIDADE Mano Menezes define time que começara atuando contra a Portuguesa Outro que pode aparecer como surpresa na partida é o atacante Cannobio que foi apresentado nas Laranjeiras nos últimos dias e já está à disposição de Mano Menezes para encarar a Portuguesa-RJ pela quarta rodada do Campeonato Carioca
Veja também
 Newell’s Old Boys não para em Keylor Navas e tem interesse em tirar Germán Cano do Fluminense
Além dos novos reforços que estarão com a delegação do Fluminense, Mano Menezes deve mandar a campo a seguinte formação: Fábio, Samuel Xavier, Manoel (Freytes), Thiago Santos e Fuentes; Bernal, Hércules (Martinelli) e Lima (Isaque); Riquelme, Keno e Kauã Elias (Lelê)
Marcelo Uliana é um jornalista que há cerca de três anos e meio atua cobrindo esportes como futebol, com ênfase em futebol brasileiro e sul-americano. É especializado na cobertura da Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras. Graduado em 2019 pela Faculdade de Jornalismo na Unimep (Universidade Metodista de Piracicaba). Atualmente no Bolavip Brasil, passou pela TV Unimep e pelo Jornal de Piracicaba, de São Paulo. É comentarista no Podcast semanal do Bolavip Brasil.

author: /author/ians/
title: 47 'terrorist sites' targeted in Turkey's airstrikes in Iraq, Syria: Minister
text: 47 'terrorist sites' targeted in Turkey's airstrikes in Iraq, Syria: Minister By [IANS](/author/ians/) | Published: October 25, 2024 02:36 AM2024-10-25T02:36:46+5:302024-10-25T02:40:08+5:30 Istanbul, Oct 25 A total of 47 "terrorist targets" have been struck, with many "terrorists" being neutralised in ... Istanbul, Oct 25 A total of 47 "terrorist targets" have been struck, with many "terrorists" being neutralised in the Turkish army's operations in Iraq and northern Syria in response to the deadly terrorist attack in Ankara, Defence Minister Yasar Guler said on Thursday. Guler made the remarks in a commemoration ceremony in Istanbul honouring those who lost their lives in the attack on Turkish Aerospace Industries Inc. (TUSAS), which resulted in five deaths and 22 injuries. "We will not rest until the last terrorist is neutralised, and we will make those responsible for these actions pay dearly," Guler said at the ceremony held at TUSAS's booth at the ongoing Saha Expo Defence and Aerospace Exhibition, Xinhua news agency reported. The Minister said 29 of the targets were in Iraq and 18 others in northern Syria. On Wednesday, Guler said the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) was behind the deadly attack at TUSAS. Following the statement, the Turkish army launched airstrikes on Iraq and northern Syria, targeting caves, shelters, storage facilities, and structures allegedly used by the PKK. Turkish authorities often use the term "neutralised" in their statements to imply the alleged "terrorists" have either surrendered, been killed, or been captured. --IANS Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor [Open in app](https://www.lokmattimes.com/install_app.htm?utm_source=www.lokmattimes.com&utm_medium=open_in_app&launch_url=https://www.lokmattimes.com/international/47-terrorist-sites-targeted-in-turkeys-airstrikes-in-iraq-syria-minister/)

title: Better Way Roofing: Transforming Roofs with Expertise and Excellence | User | theeveningleader.com
text:
Shipshewana, IN - December 26, 2024 - Better Way Roofing, a trusted name in the roofing industry, continues to deliver unparalleled roofing solutions tailored to meet diverse needs. Specializing in residential roofing services and commercial roofing services, the company has established a reputation for professionalism and superior craftsmanship.
As a local roofing company, Better Way Roofing understands the unique challenges posed by varying climates and architectural styles. This expertise enables the team to provide roofing solutions that not only protect properties but also enhance aesthetic appeal and value.
Comprehensive Residential Roofing Services
Better Way Roofing's commitment to excellence is evident in its approach to residential roofing services. The company offers comprehensive solutions, including roof inspections, repairs, replacements, and installations. Each project is managed with precision, ensuring long-lasting durability and enhanced curb appeal.
The team employs high-quality materials and cutting-edge techniques, safeguarding homes against harsh weather conditions. By prioritizing safety and sustainability, Better Way Roofing ensures that every residential roof stands the test of time.
Trusted Commercial Roofing Services
For businesses, roofing solutions must balance durability and efficiency. Better Way Roofing excels in providing commercial roofing services tailored to the needs of diverse industries. The company handles everything from small-scale repairs to large-scale installations, offering solutions that meet industry standards and timelines.
Specialists work closely with property managers to identify the best materials and designs for each project, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations. This meticulous approach has earned Better Way Roofing recognition as a go-to provider for commercial properties.
Why Choose Better Way Roofing?
What sets Better Way Roofing apart is its unwavering commitment to delivering results that exceed expectations. As a local roofing company, the team focuses on personalized service, taking into account the unique requirements of each property.
The company also prioritizes transparency in pricing and operations, offering clients peace of mind. From initial consultations to project completion, every detail is handled professionally and carefully.
Accessible Roofing Solutions
Better Way Roofing invites homeowners and business owners to explore its range of services through its comprehensive website. More information about its residential roofing services can be found here. Businesses seeking robust roofing solutions can learn more about its commercial roofing services here.
With a proven track record and a commitment to innovation, Better Way Roofing is poised to remain a leader in the roofing industry. By combining expertise, reliability, and exceptional service, the company continues to set the benchmark for quality roofing solutions.
About Better Way Roofing
Better Way Roofing is a premier provider of roofing solutions specializing in both residential and commercial projects. Known for quality craftsmanship and exceptional customer service, the company is a reliable partner for all roofing needs.

author: By: Ben Verbanic
title: United Way's 'Strong Neighborhoods Council' awards over $40,000 in neighborhood improvement mini grants to the community
text: WABASH VALLEY, Ind. (WTHI) - The United Way of the Wabash Valley’s Strong Neighborhoods Council is awarding$40,000 in funding for Neighborhood Improvement Project mini-grants across the community. This is the fourth round of this community investment for the council, whose goal is to continue to upgrade and improve neighborhoods and communities here in the Wabash Valley. Eight projects from five separate counties received $5,000 each. The projects are as follows: 1) St. Mary’s Village Community Welcome Project (West Terre Haute, IN) – Beautification - Help jump start the larger needs for beatification, removal of overgrown shrubbery, fixing dilapidated fences, and litter removal. 2) Eugene Township Community Center (Cayuga, IN) –Community Center – The Center will consist of a community room and park. Repair of peeling paint, poor lighting, empty rooms, and addition of kitchenette. A playground will also be added. 3) Standard Opera House Community Center, Phase 1 (Perrysville, IN) – Community Center –Repair and replace windows to seal the building from the weather. This will start the beginning of reconstruction. 4) Sensory Garden Sunshade (Terre Haute, IN) – Sunshade – Installation of a permanent shade port structure in Hoosier Prairie’s existing sensory garden. Open to the public. Allows for students to use the garden during hot summers. 5) Cultivating Community along the Old National Road (West Terre Haute, IN) – Beautification – The overall project supports 19 flower beds, in which a community member/organization can sponsor. The grant supports the winter, spring, and summer updates to the flowerbeds such as bulbs, plants, and mulch as well as seasonal décor. 6) Dawson Pond Revitalization Project (Washington Township, Beautification/Revitalization – The neglected pond for over 15 years will get trash cleaned out, and stocked with fish and electricity installed so lighting can be added. 7) Sugar Creek Resource Center Ramp Project (Bloomingdale, IN) – Ramp Installation – Installation of a ramp leading into the food pantry. Helps for wheelchairs, walks, crutches, as well as wagons full of items. 8) Disc Golf Course at Craig Park (Brazil, IN) –Disc Golf Installation– Installing 9 new disc golf baskets, 18 concrete slabs, and signage for the new 18-hole disc golf course at Craig Park. "The purpose of the neighborhood improvement mini grants is to beautify neighborhoods, improve public safety, but mostly to bring people together" says Dorothy Chambers with the United Way. The United Way has begun dispersing the funds for use.
